trans-unit.source: Apple DEP management for iOS devices | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Apple DEP management for iOS devices | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Deploy an enrollment profile that enrolls iOS devices purchased through the iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) “over the air” to manage Apple devices.
trans-unit.target: Deploy an enrollment profile that enrolls iOS devices purchased through the iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) “over the air” to manage Apple devices.

trans-unit.source: Enroll corporate-owned Device Enrollment Program iOS devices
trans-unit.target: Enroll corporate-owned Device Enrollment Program iOS devices

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune can deploy an enrollment profile that enrolls iOS devices purchased through the Device Enrollment Program (DEP) “over the air.”
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune can deploy an enrollment profile that enrolls iOS devices purchased through the Device Enrollment Program (DEP) “over the air.”

trans-unit.source: The enrollment package can include setup assistant options for the device.
trans-unit.target: The enrollment package can include setup assistant options for the device.

trans-unit.source: Devices enrolled through DEP cannot be un-enrolled by users.
trans-unit.target: Devices enrolled through DEP cannot be un-enrolled by users.

trans-unit.source: Apple DEP management for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Apple DEP management for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: To manage corporate-owned iOS devices with Apple’s Device Enrollment Program (DEP), your organization must join Apple DEP and acquire devices through that program.
trans-unit.target: To manage corporate-owned iOS devices with Apple’s Device Enrollment Program (DEP), your organization must join Apple DEP and acquire devices through that program.

trans-unit.source: Details of that process are available at: [https://deploy.apple.com](https://deploy.apple.com).
trans-unit.target: Details of that process are available at: [https://deploy.apple.com](https://deploy.apple.com).

trans-unit.source: Advantages of the program include hands-free set up of devices without USB-connecting each device to a computer.
trans-unit.target: Advantages of the program include hands-free set up of devices without USB-connecting each device to a computer.

trans-unit.source: Before you can enroll corporate-owned iOS devices with DEP, you need a DEP Token from Apple.
trans-unit.target: Before you can enroll corporate-owned iOS devices with DEP, you need a DEP Token from Apple.

trans-unit.source: This token allows Intune to sync information about DEP-participating devices owned by your corporation.
trans-unit.target: This token allows Intune to sync information about DEP-participating devices owned by your corporation.

trans-unit.source: It also permits Intune to perform Enrollment Profile uploads to Apple and to assign devices to those profiles.
trans-unit.target: It also permits Intune to perform Enrollment Profile uploads to Apple and to assign devices to those profiles.

trans-unit.source: **Start managing iOS devices with Microsoft Intune** Before you can enroll iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices, you must complete enable iOS management for Intune.
trans-unit.target: **Start managing iOS devices with Microsoft Intune** Before you can enroll iOS Device Enrollment Program (DEP) devices, you must complete enable iOS management for Intune.

trans-unit.source: **Get an Encryption Key** As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Download Encryption Key**.
trans-unit.target: **Get an Encryption Key** As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Download Encryption Key**.

trans-unit.source: Save the encryption key (.pem) file locally.
trans-unit.target: Save the encryption key (.pem) file locally.

trans-unit.source: The .pem file is used to request a trust-relationship certificate from the Apple Device Enrollment Program portal.
trans-unit.target: The .pem file is used to request a trust-relationship certificate from the Apple Device Enrollment Program portal.

trans-unit.source: Update a device enrollment program token
trans-unit.target: Update a device enrollment program token

trans-unit.source: **Get a Device Enrollment Program token** Go to the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.
trans-unit.target: **Get a Device Enrollment Program token** Go to the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.

trans-unit.source: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your DEP token.
trans-unit.target: This Apple ID must be used in future to renew your DEP token.

trans-unit.source: In the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) portal, go **Device Enrollment Program** > **Manage Servers**, and then click **Add MDM Server**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) portal, go **Device Enrollment Program** > **Manage Servers**, and then click **Add MDM Server**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **MDM Server Name** and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **MDM Server Name** and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The server name is for your reference to identify the MDM server.
trans-unit.target: The server name is for your reference to identify the MDM server.

trans-unit.source: It is not name or URL of the Microsoft Intune server.
trans-unit.target: It is not name or URL of the Microsoft Intune server.

trans-unit.source: The **Add <ServerName>** dialog box opens.
trans-unit.target: The **Add <ServerName>** dialog box opens.

trans-unit.source: Click **Choose File…**
trans-unit.target: Click **Choose File…**

trans-unit.source: to upload the .pem file and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: to upload the .pem file and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The **Add <ServerName>** dialog box displays a **Your Server Token** link.
trans-unit.target: The **Add <ServerName>** dialog box displays a **Your Server Token** link.

trans-unit.source: Download the server token (.p7m) file to your computer, and then click **Done**.
trans-unit.target: Download the server token (.p7m) file to your computer, and then click **Done**.

trans-unit.source: This certificate (.p7m) file is used to establish a trust relationship between Intune and Apple’s Device Enrollment Program servers.
trans-unit.target: This certificate (.p7m) file is used to establish a trust relationship between Intune and Apple’s Device Enrollment Program servers.

trans-unit.source: **Add the DEP token to Intune** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Upload the DEP Token**.
trans-unit.target: **Add the DEP token to Intune** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Upload the DEP Token**.

trans-unit.source: **Browse** to the certificate (.p7m) file, enter your **Apple ID**, and click **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: **Browse** to the certificate (.p7m) file, enter your **Apple ID**, and click **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: **Add the Corporate Device Enrollment Policy** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment** and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: **Add the Corporate Device Enrollment Policy** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment** and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Provide **General** details including **Name** and **Description**, specify whether devices assigned to the profile have user affinity or belong to a group.
trans-unit.target: Provide **General** details including **Name** and **Description**, specify whether devices assigned to the profile have user affinity or belong to a group.

trans-unit.source: **Prompt for user affinity**: The device must be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.
trans-unit.target: **Prompt for user affinity**: The device must be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.

trans-unit.source: **User affinity** should be configured for DEP-managed devices that belong to users and need to use the company portal (i.e. to install apps).
trans-unit.target: **User affinity** should be configured for DEP-managed devices that belong to users and need to use the company portal (i.e. to install apps).

trans-unit.source: **Note:** DEP devices with user affinity cannot support multifactor authentication.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** DEP devices with user affinity cannot support multifactor authentication.

trans-unit.source: **No user affinity**: The device is not affiliated with a user.
trans-unit.target: **No user affinity**: The device is not affiliated with a user.

trans-unit.source: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.
trans-unit.target: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.

trans-unit.source: Apps requiring user affiliation, including the Company Portal app used for installing line-of-business apps, won’t work.
trans-unit.target: Apps requiring user affiliation, including the Company Portal app used for installing line-of-business apps, won’t work.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Assign devices to the following group**.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Assign devices to the following group**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Select...** to choose a group.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select...** to choose a group.

trans-unit.source: Next, enable **Configure Device Enrollment Program settings for this policy** to support DEP.
trans-unit.target: Next, enable **Configure Device Enrollment Program settings for this policy** to support DEP.

trans-unit.source: Setup assistant pane
trans-unit.target: Setup assistant pane

trans-unit.source: The following settings are available for DEP-managed devices:
trans-unit.target: The following settings are available for DEP-managed devices:

trans-unit.source: **Department** - Appears when users tap "About Configuration" during activation
trans-unit.target: **Department** - Appears when users tap "About Configuration" during activation

trans-unit.source: **Support phone number** - Displayed when the user clicks the **Need Help** button during activation
trans-unit.target: **Support phone number** - Displayed when the user clicks the **Need Help** button during activation

trans-unit.source: **Preparation mode** - This state is set during activation and cannot be changed without factory resetting the device:
trans-unit.target: **Preparation mode** - This state is set during activation and cannot be changed without factory resetting the device:

trans-unit.source: **Unsupervised** - Limited management capabilities
trans-unit.target: **Unsupervised** - Limited management capabilities

trans-unit.source: **Supervised** - Enables more management options and disables Activation Lock by default
trans-unit.target: **Supervised** - Enables more management options and disables Activation Lock by default

trans-unit.source: **Lock enrollment profile to device** - This state is set during activation and cannot be changed without a factory reset
trans-unit.target: **Lock enrollment profile to device** - This state is set during activation and cannot be changed without a factory reset

trans-unit.source: **Disable** - Allows the management profile to be removed from the **Settings** menu
trans-unit.target: **Disable** - Allows the management profile to be removed from the **Settings** menu

trans-unit.source: **Enable** - (Requires **Preparation Mode** = **Supervised**) Disables iOS settings that could allow removal of the management profile
trans-unit.target: **Enable** - (Requires **Preparation Mode** = **Supervised**) Disables iOS settings that could allow removal of the management profile

trans-unit.source: **Setup Assistant Options** - These settings are optional and can be configured later in the iOS **Settings** menu
trans-unit.target: **Setup Assistant Options** - These settings are optional and can be configured later in the iOS **Settings** menu

trans-unit.source: **Passcode** - Prompt for passcode during activation.
trans-unit.target: **Passcode** - Prompt for passcode during activation.

trans-unit.source: Always require a passcode unless the device will be secured or have access controlled in some other manner (i.e. kiosk mode that restricts the device to one app).
trans-unit.target: Always require a passcode unless the device will be secured or have access controlled in some other manner (i.e. kiosk mode that restricts the device to one app).

trans-unit.source: **Location Services** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for the service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Location Services** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for the service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Restore** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for iCloud backup during activation
trans-unit.target: **Restore** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for iCloud backup during activation

trans-unit.source: **Apple ID** - An Apple ID is required to download iOS App Store apps, including those installed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: **Apple ID** - An Apple ID is required to download iOS App Store apps, including those installed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: If enabled, iOS will prompt users for an Apple ID when Intune attempts to install an app without an ID.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, iOS will prompt users for an Apple ID when Intune attempts to install an app without an ID.

trans-unit.source: **Terms and Conditions** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts users to accept Apple's terms and conditions during activation
trans-unit.target: **Terms and Conditions** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts users to accept Apple's terms and conditions during activation

trans-unit.source: **Touch ID** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Touch ID** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Apple Pay** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Apple Pay** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Zoom** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Zoom** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Siri** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Siri** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Send diagnostic data to Apple** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation
trans-unit.target: **Send diagnostic data to Apple** - If enabled, Setup Assistant prompts for this service during activation

trans-unit.source: **Enable additional Apple Configurator management** - Set to **Disallow** to prevent syncing files with iTunes or management via Apple Configurator.
trans-unit.target: **Enable additional Apple Configurator management** - Set to **Disallow** to prevent syncing files with iTunes or management via Apple Configurator.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft recommends you set to **Disallow**, export any further configuration from Apple Configurator, and then deploy as a Custom iOS configuration profile via Intune, rather than use this setting to allow manual deployment with or without a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft recommends you set to **Disallow**, export any further configuration from Apple Configurator, and then deploy as a Custom iOS configuration profile via Intune, rather than use this setting to allow manual deployment with or without a certificate.

trans-unit.source: **Disallow** - Prevents the device from communicating via USB (disables pairing)
trans-unit.target: **Disallow** - Prevents the device from communicating via USB (disables pairing)

trans-unit.source: **Allow** - Allows device communicate via USB connection for any PC or Mac
trans-unit.target: **Allow** - Allows device communicate via USB connection for any PC or Mac

trans-unit.source: **Require certificate** - Allows pairing with a Mac with a certificate imported to the enrollment profile
trans-unit.target: **Require certificate** - Allows pairing with a Mac with a certificate imported to the enrollment profile

trans-unit.source: **Assign DEP Devices for Management** Go to the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.
trans-unit.target: **Assign DEP Devices for Management** Go to the [Device Enrollment Program Portal](https://deploy.apple.com) (https://deploy.apple.com) and sign in with your company Apple ID.

trans-unit.source: Go **Deployment Program** > **Device Enrollment Program** > **Manage Devices**.
trans-unit.target: Go **Deployment Program** > **Device Enrollment Program** > **Manage Devices**.

trans-unit.source: Specify how you will **Choose Devices**, provide device information and specify details by device **Serial Number**, **Order Number**, or **Upload CSV File**.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you will **Choose Devices**, provide device information and specify details by device **Serial Number**, **Order Number**, or **Upload CSV File**.

trans-unit.source: Next, select **Assign to Server** and select the <ServerName> specified for Microsoft Intune, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Next, select **Assign to Server** and select the <ServerName> specified for Microsoft Intune, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **Synchronize DEP-Managed Devices** As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Sync now**.
trans-unit.target: **Synchronize DEP-Managed Devices** As an administrative user, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), go to **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **iOS** > **Device Enrollment Program**, and click **Sync now**.

trans-unit.source: A sync request is sent to Apple.
trans-unit.target: A sync request is sent to Apple.

trans-unit.source: To see DEP-managed devices after synchronization, in the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Groups** > **All Devices** > **Corporate Pre-enrolled devices** > **By iOS Serial Number**.
trans-unit.target: To see DEP-managed devices after synchronization, in the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Groups** > **All Devices** > **Corporate Pre-enrolled devices** > **By iOS Serial Number**.

trans-unit.source: In the **By iOS Serial Number** workspace, the **State** for managed devices reads “Not contacted” until the device is powered on and runs the Setup Assistant to enroll the device.
trans-unit.target: In the **By iOS Serial Number** workspace, the **State** for managed devices reads “Not contacted” until the device is powered on and runs the Setup Assistant to enroll the device.

trans-unit.source: To comply with Apple’s terms for acceptable DEP traffic, Intune imposes the following restrictions:
trans-unit.target: To comply with Apple’s terms for acceptable DEP traffic, Intune imposes the following restrictions:

trans-unit.source: A full DEP sync can run no more than once every 7 days.
trans-unit.target: A full DEP sync can run no more than once every 7 days.

trans-unit.source: During a full sync, Intune refreshes every serial number Apple has assigned to Intune whether the serial has previously been synced or not.
trans-unit.target: During a full sync, Intune refreshes every serial number Apple has assigned to Intune whether the serial has previously been synced or not.

trans-unit.source: If a full sync is attempted within 7 days of the previous full sync, Intune only refreshes serial numbers not already listed in Intune.
trans-unit.target: If a full sync is attempted within 7 days of the previous full sync, Intune only refreshes serial numbers not already listed in Intune.

trans-unit.source: Any sync request is given 10 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Any sync request is given 10 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: During this time or until the request succeeds, the Sync button is disabled.
trans-unit.target: During this time or until the request succeeds, the Sync button is disabled.

trans-unit.source: **Distribute devices to users** Your corporate-owned devices can now be distributed to users.
trans-unit.target: **Distribute devices to users** Your corporate-owned devices can now be distributed to users.

trans-unit.source: When an iOS device is turned on it will be enrolled for management by Intune.
trans-unit.target: When an iOS device is turned on it will be enrolled for management by Intune.

trans-unit.source: Changes to Intune group assignments
trans-unit.target: Changes to Intune group assignments

trans-unit.source: Starting in November, device group management will move to Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Starting in November, device group management will move to Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: After the transition to Azure Active Directory groups, group assignment will not appear in the **Corporate Enrollment Profile** options.
trans-unit.target: After the transition to Azure Active Directory groups, group assignment will not appear in the **Corporate Enrollment Profile** options.

trans-unit.source: Because this change will roll out over a series of months, you might not see the change right away.
trans-unit.target: Because this change will roll out over a series of months, you might not see the change right away.

trans-unit.source: After moving to the new portal, dynamic device group assignments can be defined based on the Corporate Enrollment Profile names.
trans-unit.target: After moving to the new portal, dynamic device group assignments can be defined based on the Corporate Enrollment Profile names.

trans-unit.source: This process ensures that devices pre-assigned to a device group will automatically enroll in the group with policy and apps deployed.
trans-unit.target: This process ensures that devices pre-assigned to a device group will automatically enroll in the group with policy and apps deployed.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Azure Active Directory groups
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Azure Active Directory groups

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Get ready to enroll devices
trans-unit.target: Get ready to enroll devices
